intro: Pentagonia cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas pentagonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pentagonal-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
